ResearchProjectDef.label: Nutrition IV
ResearchProjectDef.description: A nutritional drip. For, y'know, nutrition. Place adjacent to a medical bed for highest effectiveness.
ResearchProjectDef.descriptionDiscovered: By shoving food inside of a bag and letting it slowly drip into someone's body you've managed to make your first IV Drip.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Painkiller IV
ResearchProjectDef.description: A painkiller drip. Kills pain. Place adjacent to a medical bed for highest effectiveness.
ResearchProjectDef.descriptionDiscovered: Having learned from your nutritional IV research you begin to experiment more with drips in general and have created a painkiller IV

ResearchProjectDef.label: Antibiotic IV
ResearchProjectDef.description: An anitbiotic drip used to speed up illness recovery. Place adjacent to a medical bed for highest effectiveness.
ResearchProjectDef.descriptionDiscovered: Pushing antiobitics straight into the blood stream is very effective, hence why you made an antibiotic IV.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Blood IV
ResearchProjectDef.description: A drip for realtime blood transfusions. Slows down the rate a colonist bleeds out. Place adjacent to a medical bed for highest effectiveness.
ResearchProjectDef.descriptionDiscovered: You've come to discover a variant of blood which anyone's body accepts. You've learned to use it for universal blood transfusions - in real time.
